result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa A. Hazelton

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

(Cases 21CF1167, 22CF606 are called at 2:13 PM) Defendant Melissa A. Hazelton in court with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson.  Attorney Tiffany Winter in court for State of Wisconsin.  
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defense requests more time to discuss the offer with the State. Defendant would like to waive her right to a jury trial. 
Court indicates the Status Conference can be adjourned. 
Status Conference: 11/17/2022 at 10:00 AM (IN PERSON).
Status conference on October 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(3:50 PM cases 21CF1167, 22CF606 called.) Defendant Melissa A. Hazelton in court. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Melissa A. Hazelton. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advises had car troubles this morning and called Attorney Thorson's office prior to the hearing starting trying to inform Attorney Thorson she wouldn't make her court appearance.
Court orders the warrants are quashed.
Attorney Thorson advises would review the offer with the defendant and complete paperwork, requesting new date.
Status Conference in cases 21CF1167, 22CF606 scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 2 pm (1/2 hour) in person.

(11:01 AM cases 21CF1167, 22CF606 called.) Defendant Melissa A. Hazelton does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Melissa A. Hazelton. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Attorney Thorson advises attempted to contact the defendant and has spoken with the ADA regarding the case.
Attorney Thorson has no information for the defendant's non-appearance.
Court orders warrants noting the defendant was present in court when today's date and time was set.
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Cases called at 10:31 AM: 21CF1167, 22CF606.
Defendant Melissa A. Hazelton in court with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson. Attorney Tiffany Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Thorson requests an adjournment to work on a global resolution of all of the Defendants open cases.
STC: 10/13/22 at 11:00 AM (in person).
Status conference on September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

8:59 AM cases 22CF606 and 21CF1167 called. Prosecuting attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Melissa A. Hazelton appeared by video.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Melissa A. Hazelton. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
In both files: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas on all counts- Received by the Court. Thirty days to file motions. 
A status conference is scheduled for 9-8-22 at 10:30 am (in person, 30 min).
Arraignment on August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Same as Complaint.

(2:23 PM cases 21CF1167, 22CF606 called.) Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Melissa A. Hazelton in court. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Melissa A. Hazelton. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in case 22CF606 and Court accepts waiver.
Attorney Thorson to schedule Arraignment in 22CF606 and Status Conference in 21CF1167 with Branch 3 Judicial Assistant, both cases to track together.

3:30 PM Cases called: 21CF1167 & 22CF606. Defendant Melissa A. Hazelton in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Melissa A. Hazelton. Attorney Afton Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin via Zoom video. 

21CF1167: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 30 days to file motions. 

22CF606: Defense would like a Preliminary Hearing scheduled in this case.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on July 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
SPD Appointment - Attorney Robert Thorson

Conditions:
No contact with co-defendant Joseph Seay.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications or drug paraphernalia. 
Report to CTC within 24 hours of being released from jail & comply with testing/programming.

11:20am Court Commissioner Dan Smetana for Br. 3 Intake. Defendant Melissa Hazelton appeared in custody from the Eau Claire County jail with Attorney Sonya Anderson. Attorney Afton Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Bond is set. 
State requests this case be set in Br. 3 on 07/11/22 at 3:30pm to go with other open files.

Conditions:
